verses.roman:
aneka dekhinu muñi mleccha-śāstra haite
'sādhya-sādhana-vastu' nāri nirdhārite

synonyms: aneka—many; dekhinu—have studied; muñi—I; mleccha-śāstra—Mohammedan scripture; haite—from; sādhya—the ultimate goal of life; sādhana—how to approach it; vastu—matter; nāri nirdhārite—I cannot decide conclusively.
translation: "I have studied the Mohammedan scripture very extensively, but from it I cannot conclusively decide what the ultimate goal of life is or how I can approach it.
